data.name: Write long SEO articles by ChatGPT on WordPress
data.description: This flow will generate a long SEO article, with its default settings, it will generate about 1,500 - 2,000 words article. It might run slow because it calls OpenAI multiple times. âš ï¸ Don't forget to edit the settings in the Advanced Mapper step! ðŸ”¥ Feel free to change the last step to send wherever you want instead of Gmail.

input.prompt:
Act as an SEO expert speaking fluent English to write only headings (h1, h2 and h3) for an article about "{{trigger['values']['A']}}", adhere to these guidelines: "{{trigger['values']['B']}}".
Return strictly only a JSON object that contains the attribute "title" with a rephrased SEO-optimized article title, and another attribute called "outline" that contains a flat array of exactly 5 items, each item is a top level (h2) headline of an article paragraph. The array will contain string items only. Don't include the word "h2" in any of the items, don't wrap titles in quotation marks, each heading is only the text of the heading.

input.subject: [Approve Post] {{step_4.title}}
input.body_text:
Hi moderator,

A post under the title "{{step_4.title}}" was written in our blog. Take a look in your wordpress account and publish it.

(Make sure you are logged in to see the post)

input.prompt: Write the content of the section titled "{{step_2.item}}". You must adhere to these guidelines: "{{trigger['values']['B']}}". This section is part of a bigger article called "{{step_4.title}}ï»¿". Don't include the title in your output, only include the paragraphs content. Don't create a summary or conclusion paragraph. Use html tags for sub headings, create one level of sub headings only which is (h3). You can create two or three of these h3 subheadings. Don't make the subheadings sound too similar to the original section title provided to you.

template.displayName: Write long SEO articles by ChatGPT on WordPress

data.name: Save Typeform Submissions to Google Sheets
data.description:
If you want your Typeform submissions to be saved to a google sheet, this one is for you.

This template will help you do just that in addition to using OpenAI to describe the submission and send an email containing that description.

Created by: [Kevin_Alexander](https://community.activepieces.com/u/Kevin_Alexander)

template.displayName: Creates a Sheet Row & Sends Email When a New Typeform  Submission Is Received

data.name: Send ChatGPT welcome email to MailChimp new subscribers
data.description: This flow monitors new subscribers to a MailChimp audience, sends their information to ChatGPT with some context and a personalisation request, and asks it to generate a welcome email to that user, then sends the email to the user with SendGrid.

roles.content: Who won the world series in 2020?
The Los Angeles Dodgers won the World Series in 2020.

input.prompt:
Write a welcome email to this person:{{trigger}}

Strictly return a JSON object that has two fields, "subject" and "message".

Personalize the message according to the person object above. Mention a unique historic event that happened on the same day of their registration in the past (only use accurate information for this).

Context about our business (the senders of the email):
We are a group of readers, and the user has signed up for our weekly newsletter of book recommendation.

template.displayName: Send ChatGPT welcome email to MailChimp new subscribers

data.name: Write long article with Claude to WordPress

input.prompt:
Write a blog title about this idea: {{step_3[0]['values']['A']}}

Respond with the generated title only without an introduction or quotation marks

Generate a JSON array of 5 headlines about a blog titled "{{step_2}}", the array will have string items

Respond with the generated array only without an introduction or quotation marks

Write a section about "{{step_5.item}}" under the main title "{{step_2}}". Include two heading 3 titles with their paragraphs Format headlines, bold and italic using HTML tags. Follow this structure:

Section Title

Paragraph 1 Title

Paragraph 1 content

Paragraph 2 Title

Paragraph 2 content -- For reference, these are the previous sections: -- REFERENCE START -- {{step_8}} -- REFERENCE END -- Respond with the generated content only without an introduction or quotation marks

template.displayName: Write long article with Claude to WordPress

data.name: Automate Blog Writing with AI: A Step by Step Guide using OpenAI
data.description: ChatGPT is awesome, you can ask it to write a blog post for you, make some modifications and publish it. But if you have hundreds of ideas that you'd like to convert into blog posts, you will need something that runs in the background while you're on the beach (just kidding, you'll be buried under lots of other work ðŸ˜³).

input.prompt:
Write a blog post about this idea: "{{trigger['values']['A']}}" and make sure it complies with these guidelines: "{{trigger['values']['B']}}"
==
only respond with the text of the post

input.subject: "{{step_1}}" is ready for your review!
input.body_text:
Hi content team,
A new blog post is ready for your review, please check your wordpress account

template.displayName: Automate Blog Writing with AI: A Step by Step Guide using OpenAI

data.name: ChatGPT SNS Customer Service Agent
data.description: This flow creates an SMS customer service agent powered by ChatGPT. It incorporates memory of the chat history and it's contextualized to the business.

input.prompt:
Act as a competent and friendly customer support agent who works at our business. You are the Agent and you are chatting with User. Complete the responses of the chat using the business information in the Business Details section. Carry on the conversation like you are chatting, don't make a conversation opener every time you chat unless necessary. If you can't the information in the Business Details, be conservative with your answer, don't give false information to User.

Business Details
StoreX is an IT repair shop, we specialize in repairing Apple devices. Only new devices are accepted. We open all days from 8am PT to 10pm PT. We're located in San Francisco and we're opening new branches soon, no locations are specified.

Chat History
{{step_3}}
User: {{trigger.body.Body}}
Agent:

data.name: Tweet engaging content using ChatGPT
data.description: This flow will generate an engaging tweet every day and tweet it to your account to engage with your audience. The theme set in the template is Super Mario math puzzles for kids, but you can customize it to fit your business!

input.prompt: Write a tweet that is a math puzzle to engage my audience. Puzzle level is age from 10 to 18. Make the puzzle sound like a little story. The story will always contain the super mario. Don't add single or double quotations around the text of the tweet, You must ensure it fits in 240 character maximum

data.name: ChatGPT sentiment analysis of Zendesk tickets in a Google Sheet
data.description: This flow will read new tickets from your Zendesk account, analyze their sentiments and post the analysis to a Google Sheet in your account.

input.prompt:
I'll give you a support ticket we received from a customer and I want you to classify it into one of the following categories:
Satisfied, Upset, Angry, None
Your response must be only one of these 4 exact words. Don't add a . in the end of the response

Ticket content:
{{trigger.description}}

template.displayName: ChatGPT sentiment analysis of Zendesk tickets in a Google Sheet

data.name: Telegram - Airtable Order Tracking Bot
data.description:
This Telegram bot offers a streamlined experience for users seeking to connect with a business and access their contact information efficiently.

Features:
When a user input "contact", the bot promptly responds with a message providing the business contact info.

For queries other than "contact" the bot connects to the Airtable database to perform a search. If a matching entry is found, the bot displays the information on Telegram, providing users with the desired result.

If the user sends something other than "contact" the bot expects the message to be an order ID, which the bot looks up in an Airtable database, responding to the user with the order info it found.

However, if no order is found, the bot sends a message stating "Nothing found", ensuring the user is promptly informed of the search outcome.

The Airtable database has these fields:

1.Name
2.Notes
3.Status
4.OrderID

Created by: [G_M](https://community.activepieces.com/u/g_m/summary)
